property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: U.S. service members speaking with Afghan leaders

note.text: You may be younger than your counterparts, even if you have a similar rank. If your counterpart is older, address them with the respect their age deserves, while being authoritative on areas of your expertise. Be especially polite and allow them plenty of opportunities to speak.
Conversely, if you work with counterparts younger than you, they may be unwilling to challenge your opinions. When getting input, assure younger counterparts that you value their perspective.
